revision.text:
Brigadier '''Moosa Ali Jaleel''' serves as a senior officer in the Maldives National Defence Force of the Republic of Maldives. He was promoted to the rank of Brigadier on 21st April 2004.
Brig. Jaleel graduated from the National Defence College, India on December 2005 becoming the first ever maldivian to graduate from the prestigious institute. It is assumed that he has also completed the UK Royal Marines Commando course.
Brig. Jaleel's last known command post is that of CO QRF III. In the past he has held the command of various units such as QRF I and Coast Guard.
During the attack on November 3rd he commanded a small group of soldiers who were given the task of going outside the NSS HQ which was under seige in order to assess the situation outside.

During the attack on November 3rd he commanded a small group of soldiers who were given the task of going outside the NSS HQ which was under seige in order to assess the situation outside.

Brigadier '''Moosa Ali Jaleel''' serves as a senior officer in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the Republic of Maldives. He was promoted to the rank of Brigadier on 21st April 2004.
Brig. Jaleel graduated from the National Defence College, India on December 2005 becoming the first ever maldivian to graduate from the prestigious institute. It is assumed that he has also completed the UK Royal Marines Commando course. He has taken part in seminars including APCSS Executive Course and the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS).
Brig. Jaleel's last known command post is that of CO QRF III. In the past he has held the command of various units such as QRF I and Coast Guard.
During the attack on November 3rd he commanded a small group of soldiers who were given the task of going outside the NSS HQ which was under seige in order to assess the situation outside.
[[Category:Maldivian people]]

{{Wikify}}
Brigadier '''Moosa Ali Jaleel''' serves as a senior officer in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the Republic of Maldives. He was promoted to the rank of Brigadier on 21st April 2004.
Brig. Jaleel graduated from the National Defence College, India on December 2005 becoming the first ever maldivian to graduate from the prestigious institute. It is assumed that he has also completed the UK Royal Marines Commando course. He has taken part in the APCSS Executive Course and the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS).
Brig. Jaleel's last known command post is that of CO QRF III. In the past he has held the command of various frontline units such as QRF I and Coast Guard.
It is widely recognised that he played a vital role in the defence during the November 3rd attack my tamil mercenaries. He commanded a small group of soldiers who undertook the daring mission of exiting the NSS HQ which was under seige in order to assess the situation.
[[Category:Maldivian people]]

{{Wikify}}
Brigadier '''Moosa Ali Jaleel''' serves as a senior officer in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the [[Republic of Maldives]]. He was promoted to the rank of [[Brigadier]] on [[April 21]], [[2004]].
Brig. Jaleel is a graduate from the National Defence College of [[India]], becoming the first ever maldivian to graduate from the prestigious institute. It is understood that he has also completed the UK [[Royal Marines]] Commando course. He has taken part in the Asia-Pacific Center for Security Studies (APCSS) Executive Course and the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS).
Brig. Jaleel's last known command post is that of CO QRF III. In the past he has held the command of various frontline units such as QRF I and Coast Guard.
It is widely recognised that he played a vital role in mounting the defence during the November 3rd attack by tamil mercenaries from the [[PLOTE]] organisation. He commanded a small team of soldiers who undertook the daring mission of exiting the NSS HQ which was under seige in order to assess the situation.
[[Category:Maldivian people]]

[[Category:Maldivian people]]

Brigadier Moosa Ali Jaleel, RM, HRM, MSc, ndc, psc
Brigadier Moosa Ali Jaleel, RM, HRM, MSc, ndc, psc was born on 26 June 1960 at Malé, Maldives. The General Officer did his schooling at Majeediya School, Maldives and is a graduate from the Infantry Officer Cadet School, Singapore Armed Force Traning Institute, Republic of Singapore.
Brig Jaleel has the distinction of having been trained at UK, US and Indian Military Institutes, ie:- The US Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, USA. The Royal Marine Commando School, lympstone, UK.The Defence Resources Management Institute, Naval Postgraduate School, Monterey, California, USA, The Defence Services Staff College, Wellington, India. The Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies, Hawaii, USA The Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies, Washington DC, USA.The National Defence College, New Delhi, India. In addition, the General Officer has a Degree of Master of Science in Defence and Strategic Studies from The University of Madras, India.
Brig Jaleel is the Commander of Quick Reaction Force 03 with effect from 10 May 2000. The General Officer has commanded The Quick Reaction Force 01, The Special Protection Group, The Maldives National Cadet Corps and The MNDF Coast Guard.
Brig Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in the Operations of the November 3rd Armed Aggression. He is recipient of The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service.
Brig Jaleel is married to Mrs Jazeela Ibrahim and is blessed with five children, Nishan, Neerain, Noorain, Nadhir and Azzam
[[Category:Maldivian people]]

Brigadier Jaleel is the Commander of Quick Reaction Force 03 with effect from 10 May 2000. The General Officer has commanded The Quick Reaction Force 01, The Special Protection Group, The Maldives National Cadet Corps and The MNDF Coast Guard.
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in the Operations of the November 3rd Armed Aggression. He is recipient of The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service.
Brigadier Jaleel is married to Mrs Jazeela Ibrahim and is blessed with five children.

{{cleanup}} Brigadier '''Moosa Ali Jaleel''' serves as a flag officer in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the [[Republic of Maldives]]. He was promoted to the rank of [[Brigadier]] on [[April 21]], [[2004]].
Moosa Ali Jaleel Jaleel is a graduate from the National Defence College of [[India]], becoming the first ever maldivian to graduate from the prestigious institute. He has also completed the grueling UK [[Royal Marines]] Commando course which is regarded as one of the toughest of its kind in the world <ref>http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/1370070.stm About Commando Course </ref> and among others has taken part in the Asia-Pacific Center for Security Studies (APCSS) Executive Course and the Pacific Armies Management Seminar's (PAMS).
Brig. Jaleel's last known command post is that of CO QRF III. In the past he has held the command of various frontline units such as QRF I and Coast Guard.
It is widely recognised that he played a vital role in mounting the defence during the November 3rd attack by tamil mercenaries from the [[PLOTE]] organisation. He commanded a small team of soldiers who undertook the daring mission of exiting the NSS HQ which was under seige in order to assess the situation. He also functioned as the lead presidential bodyguard for a period of time after the incident. ==================================================================================================================

Brigadier Jaleel has the distinction of having been trained at UK, US and Indian Military Institutes, ie The US Army Infantry School, Fort Benning, USA. The Royal Marine Commando School, lympstone, UK. The Defence Resources Management Institute, Naval Postgraduate School, Monterey, California, USA, The Defence Services Staff College, Wellington, India. The Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies, Hawaii, USA and The Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies, Washington DC, USA. The National Defence College, New Delhi, India. In addition, the General Officer has a Degree of Master of Science in Defence and Strategic Studies from The University of Madras, India.
Brigadier Jaleel is the Commander of Quick Reaction Force 03 with effect from 10 May 2000. The General Officer has commanded The Quick Reaction Force 01, The Special Protection Group, The Maldives National Cadet Corps and The MNDF Coast Guard.
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in the Operations of the November 3rd Armed Aggression. He is recipient of The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service.
Brigadier Jaleel is married to Mrs Jazeela Ibrahim and is blessed with five children.

He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000) and The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian people]]

Brigadier '''Moosa Ali Jaleel''' RM, HRM, MSc, ndc, psc, serves as a senior officer in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the [[Republic of Maldives]] and widely regarded as being the most highly trained and capable military officer in the country. He was promoted to the rank of [[Brigadier]] on [[April 21]], [[2004]].
Brigadier Jaleel was born on 26 June 1960 at [[Male']], Maldives. He completed his secondary schooling at [[Majeediyya School]], Maldives and is a graduate from the Infantry [[Officer Cadet School (Singapore)|Officer Cadet School]], Singapore Armed Force Training Institute ([[SAFTI]]).
Brig. Jaleel has the distinction of having been trained at various UK, US and Indian Military Institutes:
;United States * [[United States Army Infantry School]], [[Fort Benning]] * Defence Resources Management Institute at [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey California * Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies, Hawaii * Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies, Washington DC.
:United Kingdom * [[Royal Marines]] Commando School, Lympstone UK
;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi.
In addition, Brig. Jaleel holds a Master of Science in Defence and Strategic Studies from The [[University of Madras]], India.
Brig. Jaleel is the Commander of Quick Reaction Force (QRF) III with effect from 10 May 2000. He has previously commanded the QRF I, Special Protection Group (SPG), The Maldives National Cadet Corps and MNDF Coast Guard.
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the November 3rd attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000) and The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.

He has also served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under seige HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian people]]

He completed his secondary schooling at [[Majeediyya School]], Maldives and is a graduate of the Infantry [[Officer Cadet School (Singapore)|Officer Cadet School]], [[SAFTI Military Institute|Singapore Armed Forces Training Institute]] (SAFTI).
=== Training ===
Brig. Jaleel has the distinction of having been trained at various UK, US and Indian Military Institutes:
;United States * [[United States Army Infantry School]], [[Fort Benning]] * Defense Resources Management Institute at [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey California * Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies, Hawaii * Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies, Washington DC
;United Kingdom * [[Royal Marines]] Commando School, Lympstone
;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi
<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:mjaleel2.jpg|thumb|right|250px|USS Cleveland's commanding officer Capt.Billy Hart, presents a plaque to the Brigadier during the visit to amphibious transport dock USS Cleveland, on Dec.18 during a joint training exercise with the MNDF QRF]] --> In addition, Brig. Jaleel holds a Master of Science Degree in Defence and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]], India. He also attends the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS) organized by the [[United States Pacific Command]].
Brig. Jaleel is the Commander of the '''Quick Reaction Force 3''' (QRF 3), an [[infantry]] [[battalion]] since 2000. He has commanded all combat/frontline units in the MNDF, including previously the '''1st Quick Reaction Force''' (QRF I), '''Special Protection Group''' (SPG), and the [[Maldivian Coast Guard]].
He has also served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.
=== Mercenary attack ===
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian people]]

revision.comment: Brig Jaleel was former Director General of Coast Guard and also the most highly trained and proven leader of the Maldivian Armed Force.

Brig. Jaleel is currently the Commanding General of the Rapid Reaction Force (RRF). He has commanded all combat/frontline units in the MNDF, including previously the '''[[Quick reaction force]] 3''' (QRF 3) an [[infantry]] [[battalion]],'''1st [[Quick reaction force]]''' (QRF I), '''Special Protection Group''' (SPG), and the [[Maldivian Coast Guard]]. He was the first Maldivian to initiate infantry oriented training in Maldives. He also trained a large amount MNDF personnel.
He has also served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.
Brigadier Jaleel is expected to be the next Chief of Staff of the Maldivian Armed Forces. He enjoys a tremendous amount of public as well as soldiers support and is expected to re-organize and restructure the MNDF as a mission oriented armed force. His experience in various MNDF Units as well as the broad knowledge and wide range of skills makes him a great asset to MNDF and the Maldives.
=== Mercenary attack ===
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi

His experience in various MNDF Units as well as the broad knowledge and wide range of skills makes him a great asset to MNDF and the Maldives.
=== Mercenary attack ===
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

Brigadier Jaleel was born on [[26 June]] [[1960]] in [[Malé]], Maldives. Brig. Jaleel has the distinction of having been trained at various UK, US and Indian Military Institutes:
;United States * [[United States Army Infantry School]], [[Fort Benning]] (Infantry Officer Basic Course / Infantry Officer Advance Course) * Defense Resources Management Institute at [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey California * Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies, Hawaii * Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies, Washington DC
;United Kingdom * [[Royal Marines]] Commando School, Lympstone (All Arms Commando Course)
;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi
<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:mjaleel2.jpg|thumb|right|250px|USS Cleveland's commanding officer Capt.Billy Hart, presents a plaque to the Brigadier during the visit to amphibious transport dock USS Cleveland, on Dec.18 during a joint training exercise with the MNDF QRF]] --> In addition, Brig. Jaleel holds a Master of Science Degree in Defence and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]], India. Brig. Jaleel is currently the Commanding General of the Rapid Reaction Force (RRF). After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.

He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
His courageous actions was displayed during the 116 Annivarsary of the MNDF.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

[[Image:Jaleel1.jpg|thumb|right|210px|Brig. Jaleel at the Pacific Armies Management Seminar in Fiji]] Brigadier '''Moosa Ali Jaleel''' RM HRM MSc ndc psc serves as a [[flag officer]] in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the [[Republic of Maldives]] and is widely regarded as being the most highly trained and capable military officer in the country. He was promoted to the rank of [[Brigadier]] on [[April 21]], [[2004]]. <!-- Unsourced image removed: [[Image:Jaleelpromote.jpg|thumb|right|210px|The President presenting the letter of promotion to the rank of Brigadier, to Colonel Moosa Ali Jaleel on 21 April 2004]] --> == Biography ==
Brigadier Jaleel was born on [[26 June]] [[1960]] in [[Malé]], Maldives. He completed his secondary schooling at [[Majeediyya School]], Maldives and is a graduate of the Infantry [[Officer Cadet School (Singapore)|Officer Cadet School]], [[SAFTI Military Institute|Singapore Armed Forces Training Institute]] (SAFTI). Brig. Jaleel has the distinction of having been trained at various UK, US and Indian Military Institutes:
;United States * [[United States Army Infantry School]], [[Fort Benning]] (Infantry Officer Basic Course / Infantry Officer Advance Course) * Defense Resources Management Institute at [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey California * Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies, Hawaii * Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies, Washington DC
;United Kingdom * [[Royal Marines]] Commando School, Lympstone (All Arms Commando Course)
;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi
<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:mjaleel2.jpg|thumb|right|250px|USS Cleveland's commanding officer Capt.Billy Hart, presents a plaque to the Brigadier during the visit to amphibious transport dock USS Cleveland, on Dec.18 during a joint training exercise with the MNDF QRF]] --> In addition, Brig. Jaleel holds a Master of Science Degree in Defence and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]], India. He also attends the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS) organized by the [[United States Pacific Command]].
He has commanded all combat/frontline units in the MNDF, including previously the '''[[Quick Reaction Force]] III''' (QRF 3) an [[infantry]] [[battalion]],'''[[Quick Reaction Force I]]''' (QRF I), '''Special Protection Group''' (SPG), and the [[Maldivian Coast Guard]]. He was the first Maldivian to initiate infantry oriented training in Maldives. He also trained a large amount MNDF personnel.
He is currently serving as the Commanding General of the Rapid Reaction Force of the Maldives National Defence Force. He is responsible for the security and safety of key military installations and home land denfece against any interal or external military threat.
He has also served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.
Brigadier Jaleel is expected to be the next Chief of Defence Force. He enjoys a tremendous amount of public as well as soldiers support and is expected to re-organize and restructure the MNDF as a mission oriented armed force. His experience in various MNDF Units as well as the broad knowledge and wide range of skills makes him a great asset to MNDF and the Maldives.
=== Mercenary attack ===
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
His courageous actions was displayed during the 116 Annivarsary of the MNDF.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.

Much of the details surrounding the mission remains to be classified. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
His courageous actions was displayed in the musical-drama of the November 3rd action at the HQ, during the 116 Annivarsary of the MNDF.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

[[Image:Jaleel1.jpg|thumb|right|210px|Brig. Jaleel at the Pacific Armies Management Seminar in Fiji]] Brigadier '''Moosa Ali Jaleel''' RM HRM MSc ndc psc serves as a [[flag officer]] in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the [[Republic of Maldives]] and is widely regarded as being the most highly trained and capable military officer in the country. He was promoted to the rank of [[Brigadier]] on [[April 21]], [[2004]]. <!-- Unsourced image removed: [[Image:Jaleelpromote.jpg|thumb|right|210px|The President presenting the letter of promotion to the rank of Brigadier, to Colonel Moosa Ali Jaleel on 21 April 2004]] --> == Biography ==
Brigadier Meehuna Moshey Boagalhi (PIMP)Jaleel was born on [[26 June]] [[1960]] in [[Malé]], Maldives. He completed his secondary schooling at [[Majeediyya School]], Maldives and is a graduate of the Infantry [[Officer Cadet School (Singapore)|Officer Cadet School]], [[SAFTI Military Institute|Singapore Armed Forces Training Institute]] (SAFTI). Brig. Jaleel has the distinction of having been trained at various UK, US and Indian Military Institutes:
;United States * [[United States Army Infantry School]] - [[Fort Benning]] (Infantry Officer Basic Course / Infantry Officer Advance Course) * Defense Resources Management Institute at [[Naval Postgraduate School]] - Monterey California * Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies - Hawaii * Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies - Washington DC
;United Kingdom * [[Royal Marines]] Commando School - Lympstone ([[All Arms Commando Course]])
;India * Defence Services Staff College - Wellington * National Defence College - New Delhi
<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:mjaleel2.jpg|thumb|right|250px|USS Cleveland's commanding officer Capt.Billy Hart, presents a plaque to the Brigadier during the visit to amphibious transport dock USS Cleveland, on Dec.18 during a joint training exercise with the MNDF QRF]] --> In addition, Brig. Jaleel holds a Master of Science Degree in Defence and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]], India. He also attends the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS) organized by the [[United States Pacific Command]].
He has commanded all combat/frontline units in the MNDF, including previously the '''Quick Reaction Force III''' (QRF 3) an [[infantry]] [[battalion]], '''Quick Reaction Force I''' (QRF I), '''Special Protection Group''' (SPG), and the [[Maldivian Coast Guard]]. He was the first Maldivian to initiate infantry oriented training in Maldives. He also trained a large amount MNDF personnel.
He is currently serving as the '''Commanding General''' of the '''Rapid Reaction Force''' of MNDF. He is responsible for the security and safety of key military installations and home land defence against any internal or external military threat.
He has also served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.
Brigadier Jaleel is expected to be the next Chief of Defence Force (CDF). He enjoys a tremendous amount of public as well as soldiers support and is expected to re-organize and restructure the MNDF as a mission oriented armed force. His experience in various MNDF Units as well as the broad knowledge and wide range of skills makes him a great asset to MNDF and the Maldives.
=== Mercenary attack ===
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. This undoubtedly remains to be the most dangerous and daring mission in the modern military history of the country. The soldiers who undertook this mission were of the utmost caliber, knowing that they were choosing to run out from a base under siege onto the oncoming hail of gunfire. Much of the details surrounding the mission remains to be classified. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
His courageous actions was displayed in the musical-drama of the November 3rd action at the HQ, during the 116 Annivarsary of the MNDF.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

=== Mercenary attack ===
== when the enemies were in strong fire attack crazy Jaleel getout for close reccy.heheh what a fun ==
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
His courageous actions was displayed during the 116 Annivarsary of the MNDF.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

revision.text:
[[Image:Jaleel1.jpg|thumb|right|210px|Brig. Jaleel at the Pacific Armies Management Seminar in Fiji]] Brigadier '''Moosa Ali Jaleel''' RM HRM MSc ndc psc serves as a [[flag officer]] in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the [[Republic of Maldives]] and is widely regarded as being the most highly trained and capable military officer in the country. He was promoted to the rank of [[Brigadier]] on [[April 21]], [[2004]]. <!-- Unsourced image removed: [[Image:Jaleelpromote.jpg|thumb|right|210px|The President presenting the letter of promotion to the rank of Brigadier, to Colonel Moosa Ali Jaleel on 21 April 2004]] --> == Biography ==
Brigadier Jaleel was born on [[26 June]] [[1960]] in [[Malé]], Maldives. He completed his secondary schooling at [[Majeediyya School]], Maldives and is a graduate of the Infantry [[Officer Cadet School (Singapore)|Officer Cadet School]], [[SAFTI Military Institute|Singapore Armed Forces Training Institute]] (SAFTI). Brig. Jaleel has the distinction of having been trained at various UK, US and Indian Military Institutes:
;United States * [[United States Army Infantry School]], [[Fort Benning]] (Infantry Officer Basic Course / Infantry Officer Advance Course) * Defense Resources Management Institute at [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey California * Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies, Hawaii * Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies, Washington DC
;United Kingdom * [[Royal Marines]] Commando School, Lympstone (All Arms Commando Course)
;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi
<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:mjaleel2.jpg|thumb|right|250px|USS Cleveland's commanding officer Capt.Billy Hart, presents a plaque to the Brigadier during the visit to amphibious transport dock USS Cleveland, on Dec.18 during a joint training exercise with the MNDF QRF]] --> In addition, Brig. Jaleel holds a Master of Science Degree in Defence and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]], India. He also attends the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS) organized by the [[United States Pacific Command]].
Brig. Jaleel is currently the Commanding General of the Rapid Reaction Force (RRF). He has commanded all combat/frontline units in the MNDF, including previously the '''[[Quick reaction force]] 3''' (QRF 3) an [[infantry]] [[battalion]],'''1st [[Quick reaction force]]''' (QRF I), '''Special Protection Group''' (SPG), and the [[Maldivian Coast Guard]]. He was the first Maldivian to initiate infantry oriented training in Maldives. He also trained a large amount MNDF personnel.
He is currently serving as the Commanding General of the Rapid Reaction Force of the Maldives National Defence Force. He is responsible for the security and safety of key military installations and home land denfece against any interal or external military threat.
He has also served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.
Brigadier Jaleel is expected to be the next Chief of Staff of the Maldivian Armed Forces. He enjoys a tremendous amount of public as well as soldiers support and is expected to re-organize and restructure the MNDF as a mission oriented armed force. His experience in various MNDF Units as well as the broad knowledge and wide range of skills makes him a great asset to MNDF and the Maldives.
=== Mercenary attack ===
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
His courageous actions was displayed during the 116 Annivarsary of the MNDF.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

Brigadier Jaleel was born on [[26 June]] [[1960]] in [[Malé]], Maldives. He completed his secondary schooling at [[Majeediyya School]], Maldives and is a graduate of the Infantry [[Officer Cadet School (Singapore)|Officer Cadet School]], [[SAFTI Military Institute|Singapore Armed Forces Training Institute]] (SAFTI). ;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi
<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:mjaleel2.jpg|thumb|right|250px|USS Cleveland's commanding officer Capt.Billy Hart, presents a plaque to the Brigadier during the visit to amphibious transport dock USS Cleveland, on Dec.18 during a joint training exercise with the MNDF QRF]] --> In addition, Brig. He also trained a large amount MNDF personnel and has served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.

He enjoys a tremendous amount of public as well as soldiers support and is expected to re-organize and restructure the MNDF as a mission oriented armed force. His experience in various MNDF Units as well as the broad knowledge and wide range of skills makes him a great asset to MNDF and the Maldives.
=== Mercenary attack ===
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
His courageous actions was displayed during the 116 Annivarsary of the MNDF.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
His courageous actions was displayed during the 116 Annivarsary of the MNDF.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

[[Image:Jaleel1.jpg|thumb|right|210px|Brig. Jaleel at the Pacific Armies Management Seminar in Fiji]] Brigadier '''Moosa Ali Jaleel''' (aka CO) RM HRM MSc ndc psc serves as the Vice Chief of Defence Force in the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the [[Republic of Maldives]] and is widely regarded as being the most highly trained and capable military officer in the country. He was promoted to the rank of [[Brigadier]] on [[April 21]], [[2004]].
Brigadier Moosa Jaleel was appointed to the post of Vice Chief of Defence Force on the 6th November 2008 under the Armed Forces Act 1/2008.
<!-- Unsourced image removed: [[Image:Jaleelpromote.jpg|thumb|right|210px|The President presenting the letter of promotion to the rank of Brigadier, to Colonel Moosa Ali Jaleel on 21 April 2004]] --> == Biography ==
Brigadier Jaleel was born on [[26 June]] [[1960]] in [[Malé]], Maldives. He completed his secondary schooling at [[Majeediyya School]], Maldives and is a graduate of the Infantry [[Officer Cadet School (Singapore)|Officer Cadet School]], [[SAFTI Military Institute|Singapore Armed Forces Training Institute]] (SAFTI). Brig. Jaleel has the distinction of having been trained at various UK, US and Indian Military Institutes:
;United States * [[United States Army Infantry School]], [[Fort Benning]] (Infantry Officer Basic Course / Infantry Officer Advance Course) * Defense Resources Management Institute at [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey California * Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies, Hawaii * Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies, Washington DC
;United Kingdom * [[Royal Marines]] Commando School, Lympstone ([[All Arms Commando Course]])
;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi
<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:mjaleel2.jpg|thumb|right|250px|USS Cleveland's commanding officer Capt.Billy Hart, presents a plaque to the Brigadier during the visit to amphibious transport dock USS Cleveland, on Dec.18 during a joint training exercise with the MNDF QRF]] --> In addition, Brig. Jaleel holds a Master of Science Degree in Defence and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] India. He also attends the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS) organized by the [[United States Pacific Command]].
He has commanded all combat/frontline units in the MNDF including previously the '''Quick Reaction Force III''' (QRF 3), '''Quick Reaction Force I''' (QRF I), '''Special Protection Group''' (SPG) and the [[Maldivian Coast Guard]]. He was the first Maldivian to initiate infantry oriented training in Maldives. He trained a large amount MNDF personnel and has also served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.
He is currently serving as the '''Commanding General''' of the '''Rapid Reaction Force''' (RRF) of the Maldives National Defence Force. He is responsible for the security and safety of key military installations and home land defence against any internal or external military threat.
Brigadier Jaleel is expected to be the next Chief of Defence Force of the MNDF. He enjoys a tremendous amount of public as well as soldiers support and is expected to re-organize and restructure the MNDF as a mission oriented armed force. His experience in various MNDF Units as well as the broad knowledge and wide range of skills makes him a great asset to MNDF and the Maldives.
Among his distinctions he's the first Maldivian to complete Officer Cadet training and the only Maldivian graduate of Singapore Armed Forces Officer Cadet School. The only Maldivian to undertake the UK Royal Marines All Arms Commando Course, as such he's entitled to wear the Commando badge of UK [[Royal Marines]] which are one of the world's most elite fighting force. Furthermore he's the first Maldivian to accomplish Defence College / War College studies, which is the highest level of military studies attainable.
=== Mercenary attack ===
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
His courageous actions was displayed during the 116 Annivarsary of the MNDF.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:mjaleel2.jpg|thumb|right|250px|USS Cleveland's commanding officer Capt.Billy Hart, presents a plaque to the Brigadier during the visit to amphibious transport dock USS Cleveland, on Dec.18 during a joint training exercise with the MNDF QRF]] --> In addition, Brig. Jaleel holds a Master of Science Degree in Defence and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] India. He also attends the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS) organized by the [[United States Pacific Command]].
He has commanded all front line infantry units in the MNDF including the '''Rapid Reaction Force''' (RRF), '''Quick Reaction Force III''' (QRF 3), '''Quick Reaction Force I''' (QRF I), '''Special Protection Group''' (SPG) and has also served as the Director General of [[Maldivian Coast Guard]]. He was the first Maldivian to initiate infantry oriented training in Maldives. He trained a large amount MNDF personnel and also served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.
He enjoys a tremendous amount of public as well as soldiers support and is expected to re-organize and restructure the MNDF as a mission oriented armed force. His experience in various MNDF Units as well as the broad knowledge and wide range of skills makes him a great asset to MNDF and the Maldives.
Among his distinctions he's the first Maldivian to complete Officer Cadet training and the only Maldivian graduate of Singapore Armed Forces Officer Cadet School. The only Maldivian to undertake the UK Royal Marines All Arms Commando Course, as such he's entitled to wear the Commando badge of UK [[Royal Marines]] which are one of the world's most elite fighting force. Furthermore he's the first Maldivian to accomplish Defence College / War College studies, which is the highest level of military studies attainable.
=== Mercenary attack ===
Brigadier Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Brig. Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
His courageous actions was displayed during the 116 Annivarsary of the MNDF.
== Family ==
Brigadier Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

[[Image:Jaleel1.jpg|thumb|right|210px|Brig. Jaleel at the Pacific Armies Management Seminar in Fiji]] Brigadier '''Moosa Ali Jaleel''' RM HRM MSc ndc psc is the '''Chief of Defence Force''' of the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] and is widely regarded as being the most highly trained and capable military officer in the country. The people who are knowledgeable about [[1988 Maldives Coup|the November 3rd 1988 incident]] and Brig. Jaleel's bravery and dedicated action that day hold him in the highest regard and respect. He was promoted to the rank of [[Brigadier]] on [[April 21]], [[2004]].
Brigadier Moosa Jaleel was appointed to the post of '''Chief of Defence Force''' on the 18th November 2008 by the President HE [[Mohamed Nasheed]].
<!-- Unsourced image removed: [[Image:Jaleelpromote.jpg|thumb|right|210px|The President presenting the letter of promotion to the rank of Brigadier, to Colonel Moosa Ali Jaleel on 21 April 2004]] --> == Biography ==
Brigadier Jaleel was born on [[26 June]] [[1960]] in [[Malé]], Maldives. He completed his secondary schooling at [[Majeediyya School]], Maldives and is a graduate of the Infantry [[Officer Cadet School (Singapore)|Officer Cadet School]], [[SAFTI Military Institute|Singapore Armed Forces Training Institute]] (SAFTI). Brig. Jaleel has the distinction of having been trained at various UK, US and Indian Military Institutes:
;United States * [[United States Army Infantry School]], [[Fort Benning]] (Infantry Officer Basic Course / Infantry Officer Advance Course) * Defense Resources Management Institute at [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey California * Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies, Hawaii * Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies, Washington DC
;United Kingdom * [[Royal Marines]] Commando School, Lympstone ([[All Arms Commando Course]])
;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi

General Jaleel's bravery and dedicated action that day hold him in the highest regard and respect.
Maj. General Moosa Jaleel was appointed to the post of '''Chief of Defence Force''' on the 18th November 2008 by the President HE [[Mohamed Nasheed]].
<!-- Unsourced image removed: [[Image:Jaleelpromote.jpg|thumb|right|210px|The President presenting the letter of promotion to the rank of Brigadier, to Colonel Moosa Ali Jaleel on 21 April 2004]] --> == Biography ==
Maj. General Jaleel was born on [[26 June]] [[1960]] in [[Malé]], Maldives. He completed his secondary schooling at [[Majeediyya School]] and is a graduate of the Infantry [[Officer Cadet School (Singapore)|Officer Cadet School]], [[SAFTI Military Institute|Singapore Armed Forces Training Institute]] (SAFTI).
Maj. General Jaleel has the distinction of having been trained at various UK, US and Indian Military Institutes:
;United States * [[United States Army Infantry School]], [[Fort Benning]] (Infantry Officer Basic Course / Infantry Officer Advance Course) * Defense Resources Management Institute at [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey California * Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies, Hawaii * Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies, Washington DC
;United Kingdom * [[Royal Marines]] Commando School, Lympstone ([[All Arms Commando Course]])
;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi
<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:mjaleel2.jpg|thumb|right|250px|USS Cleveland's commanding officer Capt.Billy Hart, presents a plaque to the Brigadier during the visit to amphibious transport dock USS Cleveland, on Dec.18 during a joint training exercise with the MNDF QRF]] --> In addition, Maj. General Jaleel holds a Master of Science Degree in Defence and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] India. He also attends the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS) organized by the [[United States Pacific Command]].
He has commanded all front line infantry units in the MNDF including the '''Rapid Reaction Force''' (RRF), '''Quick Reaction Force III''' (QRF 3), '''Quick Reaction Force I''' (QRF I), '''Special Protection Group''' (SPG) and has also served as the Director General of [[Maldivian Coast Guard]]. He was the first Maldivian to initiate infantry oriented training in Maldives. He trained a large amount MNDF personnel and also served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.
He enjoys a tremendous amount of public as well as soldiers support and is expected to re-organize and restructure the MNDF as a mission oriented armed force. His experience in various MNDF Units as well as the broad knowledge and wide range of skills makes him a great asset to MNDF and the Maldives.
Among his distinctions he's the first Maldivian to complete Officer Cadet training and the only Maldivian graduate of Singapore Armed Forces Officer Cadet School. The only Maldivian to undertake the UK [[Royal Marines]] [[All Arms Commando Course]], as such he's entitled to wear the Commando badge of UK [[Royal Marines]] which is one of the world's most elite fighting forces. Furthermore he's the first Maldivian to accomplish Defence College / War College studies, which is the highest level of military studies attainable.
=== Mercenary attack ===
Maj. General Jaleel was awarded the Huravee Ran Medal (1989) for gallantry in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
In the November 3rd operation he is distinguished as the commander of the Recce patrol. After an aborted attempt at leaving the under siege HQ in motor vehicles, they ran out on foot through the (then) Police HQ gate and came under intensive fire. This resulted in the loss of 3 members from the patrol. The mission was carried out in success and they returned to the HQ. During the Nov 3rd operations Maj. General Jaleel received several shrapnel wounds, with which he continued operating.
His courageous actions was displayed during the 116 Annivarsary of the MNDF.
== Family ==
Maj. General Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

<!-- Unsourced image removed: [[Image:Jaleelpromote.jpg|thumb|right|210px|The President presenting the letter of promotion to the rank of Brigadier, to Colonel Moosa Ali Jaleel on 21 April 2004]] --> == Biography ==
Maj. General Jaleel was born on [[26 June]] [[1960]] in [[Malé]], Maldives. He completed his secondary schooling at [[Majeediyya School]] and is a graduate of the Infantry [[Officer Cadet School (Singapore)|Officer Cadet School]], [[SAFTI Military Institute|Singapore Armed Forces Training Institute]] (SAFTI).
Maj. General Jaleel has the distinction of having been trained at various UK, US and Indian Military Institutes:
;United States * [[United States Army Infantry School]], [[Fort Benning]] (Infantry Officer Basic Course / Infantry Officer Advance Course) * Defense Resources Management Institute at [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey California * Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies, Hawaii * Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies, Washington DC
;United Kingdom * [[Royal Marines]] Commando School, Lympstone ([[All Arms Commando Course]])
;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi
<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:mjaleel2.jpg|thumb|right|250px|USS Cleveland's commanding officer Capt.Billy Hart, presents a plaque to the Brigadier during the visit to amphibious transport dock USS Cleveland, on Dec.18 during a joint training exercise with the MNDF QRF]] --> In addition, Maj. General Jaleel holds a Master of Science Degree in Defence and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] India. He also attends the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS) organized by the [[United States Pacific Command]].
He has commanded all front line infantry units in the MNDF including the '''Rapid Reaction Force''' (RRF), '''Quick Reaction Force III''' (QRF 3), '''Quick Reaction Force I''' (QRF I), '''Special Protection Group''' (SPG) and has also served as the Director General of [[Maldivian Coast Guard]]. He was the first Maldivian to initiate infantry oriented training in Maldives. He trained a large amount MNDF personnel and also served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.
He enjoys a tremendous amount of public as well as soldiers support and is expected to re-organize and restructure the MNDF as a mission oriented armed force. His experience in various MNDF Units as well as the broad knowledge and wide range of skills makes him a great asset to MNDF and the Maldives.
Among his distinctions he's the first Maldivian to complete Officer Cadet training and the only Maldivian graduate of Singapore Armed Forces Officer Cadet School. The only Maldivian to undertake the UK [[Royal Marines]] [[All Arms Commando Course]], as such he's entitled to wear the Commando badge of UK [[Royal Marines]] which is one of the world's most elite fighting forces. Furthermore he's the first Maldivian to accomplish Defence College / War College studies, which is the highest level of military studies attainable.
=== Military Decorations ===
Maj. General Jaleel is a highly decorated officer, among which he is the recepient of the second highest gallentry award Medal for Exceptional Bravey (Huravee Ran Medal - 1989) for his bravery in operations during the [[November 3]] attack by [[PLOTE]] mercenaries. He has also achieved The 03 November Medal (1989), The Presidential Medal (1992), The National Security Service Medal (1993), The Distinguished Service Medal (2000), The Dedicated Service Medal (2000) and The Medal of Discipline (2004), for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
=== November 3rd 1988 attack ===
General Jaleel played a pivotal role in organizing and leading the defence of the NSS HQ during the attack. His military training and knowledge proved to be most valuable to the commanders at the NSS HQ. As proof to his action stands the fact that he received a bullet/shrapnel injury to his leg early on while retaliating to the attacker at the North-East corner of the Bandaara Koshi where the fighting was most intense.
His bravery and dedication are most notable as the Commander of the Recce patrol. The Recce patrol was an effort to venture of the NSS HQ which was under siege to retaliate and gather knowledge of the attacker. The first attempt was made to leave the HQ in buses with a tractor leading the way, this effort was aborted after the gate could not be opened as it was jammed due to damage. The second attempt was made through the Defence Ministry gate (then Police HQ gate) on foot. 11 soldiers with task force training volunteered for this mission. After being organized and briefed on the mission by Gen. Jaleel (then Lt.), the patrol was addressed by Maj. Gen (Ret.) Mohamed Zahir (then Major) who was the leading Commander at the NSS HQ at the time.
The patrol formed up on the half wall fronting the street then with Gen. Jaleel, the commander at the lead of the patrol, ran out through the gate and along Ameeru Ahmed magu towards Huravee Building. Due to reasons unknown only 9 member were able to run out the gate with 2 members remaining inside. As the attackers noticed the patrol running out of the HQ they intensified the fire towards them and additionally a member of the patrol slipped and was unable to use his weapon to return fire which resulted in 3 member of the patrol being killed under fire. The remaining 6 members completed their mission and returned back inside the base through the same gate.
The mission is undoubtedly the most daring in the modern military history of the country. The soldiers who volunteered for the mission undertook it with full knowledge that they were venturing out a HQ which was under seige and into the hail of bullets from the attackers. And Maj. Gen Jaleel holds a legendary status in the MNDF as the commander who lead this mission.
== Family ==
Maj. General Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:mjaleel2.jpg|thumb|right|250px|USS Cleveland's commanding officer Capt.Billy Hart, presents a plaque to the Brigadier during the visit to amphibious transport dock USS Cleveland, on Dec.18 during a joint training exercise with the MNDF QRF]] --> In addition, Maj. General Jaleel holds a Master of Science Degree in Defence and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] India. He also attends the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS) organized by the [[United States Pacific Command]].
He has commanded all front line infantry units in the MNDF including the '''Rapid Reaction Force''' (RRF), '''Quick Reaction Force III''' (QRF 3), '''Quick Reaction Force I''' (QRF I), '''Special Protection Group''' (SPG) and has also served as the Director General of [[Maldivian Coast Guard]]. He was the first Maldivian to initiate infantry oriented training in Maldives. He trained a large amount MNDF personnel and also served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.
He enjoys a tremendous amount of public as well as soldiers support and is expected to re-organize and restructure the MNDF as a mission oriented armed force. His experience in various MNDF Units as well as the broad knowledge and wide range of skills makes him a great asset to MNDF and the Maldives.
Among his distinctions he's the first Maldivian to complete Officer Cadet training and the only Maldivian graduate of Singapore Armed Forces Officer Cadet School. The only Maldivian to undertake the UK [[Royal Marines]] [[All Arms Commando Course]], as such he's entitled to wear the Commando badge of UK [[Royal Marines]] which is one of the world's most elite fighting forces. Furthermore he's the first Maldivian to accomplish Defence College / War College studies, which is the highest level of military studies attainable.
=== Military Decorations ===
Maj. General Jaleel is a highly decorated officer with 8 service medals and 7 service ribbons for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
; Service medal decorations include: * The Medal for Exceptional Bravey (Huravee Ran Medal) * The 03 November Medal * The Presidential Medal * The MNDF Service Medal * The Distinguished Service Medal * The Dedicated Service Medal * The Medal of Good Conduct * The Centenary Medal
=== November 3rd 1988 attack ===
Maj. General Jaleel played a pivotal role in organizing and leading the defence of the NSS HQ during the attack. His military training and knowledge proved to be most valuable to the commanders at the NSS HQ. He received a bullet/shrapnel injury to his leg early on while retaliating to the attacker at the North-East corner of the Bandaara Koshi where the fighting was most intense but even with this injury he continued performing throughout the incident remarkably.
His bravery and dedication are most notable as the Commander of the Recce patrol. The Recce patrol was an effort to venture of the NSS HQ which was under siege to retaliate and gather knowledge of the attacker. The first attempt was made to leave the HQ in buses with a tractor leading the way, this effort was aborted after the gate could not be opened as it was jammed due to damage. The second attempt was made through the Defence Ministry gate (then Police HQ gate) on foot. 11 soldiers with task force training volunteered for this mission. After being organized and briefed on the mission by Maj. Gen Jaleel (then Lt.), the patrol was addressed by Maj. Gen (Ret.) Mohamed Zahir (then Major) who was the leading Commander at the NSS HQ at the time.
The patrol formed up on the half wall fronting the street then with Maj. Gen Jaleel, the commander at the lead of the patrol, ran out through the gate and along Ameeru Ahmed magu towards Huravee Building. Due to reasons unknown only 9 member were able to run out the gate with 2 members remaining inside. As the attackers noticed the patrol running out of the HQ they intensified the fire towards them and additionally a member of the patrol slipped and was unable to use his weapon to return fire which resulted in 3 member of the patrol being killed under fire. The remaining 6 members completed their mission and returned back inside the base through the same gate.
The mission is undoubtedly the most daring in the modern military history of the country. The soldiers who volunteered for the mission undertook it with full knowledge that they were venturing out a HQ which was under siege and into the hail of bullets from the attackers. And Maj. Gen Jaleel holds a legendary status in the MNDF as the commander who led this mission.
== Family ==
Maj. General Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

;United States * [[United States Army Infantry School]], [[Fort Benning]] (Infantry Officer Basic Course / Infantry Officer Advance Course) * Defense Resources Management Institute at [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey California * Asia Pacific Centre for Security Studies, Hawaii * Near East South Asia Centre for Strategic Studies, Washington DC
;United Kingdom * [[Royal Marines]] Commando School, Lympstone ([[All Arms Commando Course]])
;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi
<!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:mjaleel2.jpg|thumb|right|250px|USS Cleveland's commanding officer Capt.Billy Hart, presents a plaque to the Brigadier during the visit to amphibious transport dock USS Cleveland, on Dec.18 during a joint training exercise with the MNDF QRF]] --> In addition, Maj. General Jaleel holds a Master of Science Degree in Defence and Strategic Studies from the [[University of Madras]] India. He also attends the Pacific Armies Management Seminar (PAMS) organized by the [[United States Pacific Command]].
He has commanded all front line infantry units in the MNDF including the '''Rapid Reaction Force''' (RRF), '''Quick Reaction Force III''' (QRF 3), '''Quick Reaction Force I''' (QRF I), '''Special Protection Group''' (SPG) and has also served as the Director General of [[Maldivian Coast Guard]]. He was the first Maldivian to initiate infantry oriented training in Maldives. He trained a large amount MNDF personnel and also served as the Commanding Officer of the Maldives National Cadet Corp.
He enjoys a tremendous amount of public as well as soldiers support and is expected to re-organize and restructure the MNDF as a mission oriented armed force. His experience in various MNDF Units as well as the broad knowledge and wide range of skills makes him a great asset to MNDF and the Maldives.
Among his distinctions he's the first Maldivian to complete Officer Cadet training and the only Maldivian graduate of Singapore Armed Forces Officer Cadet School. The only Maldivian to undertake the UK [[Royal Marines]] [[All Arms Commando Course]], as such he's entitled to wear the Commando badge of UK [[Royal Marines]] which is one of the world's most elite fighting forces. Furthermore he's the first Maldivian to accomplish Defence College / War College studies, which is the highest level of military studies attainable.
=== Military Decorations ===
Maj. General Jaleel is the most highly decorated officer currently in service, with 8 Service Medals and 9 Service Ribbons for his exemplary leadership and distinguished service in the defence force.
; Service Medal decorations * The Medal for Exceptional Bravery (Huravee Ran Medal) * The Distinguished Service Medal * The Presidential Medal * The 03 November Medal * The MNDF Service Medal * The Dedicated Service Medal * The Medal of Good Conduct * The Centinary Medal
; Service Ribbon decorations * Presidential Ribbon * Long Service Ribbon * Dedicated Service Ribbon * MNDF Ribbon * Acheivement Ribbon (Twice) * Special Service Ribbon * Good Conduct Ribbon (Twice)
=== November 3rd 1988 attack ===This attack was organized by the current President HE Nasheed's family and friends
Maj. General Jaleel played a pivotal role in organizing and leading the defence of the NSS HQ during the attack. His military training and knowledge proved to be most valuable to the commanders at the NSS HQ. He received a bullet/shrapnel injury to his leg early on while retaliating to the attacker at the North-East corner of the Bandaara Koshi where the fighting was most intense but even with this injury he continued performing throughout the incident remarkably.
His bravery and dedication are most notable as the Commander of the Recce patrol. The Recce patrol was an effort to venture of the NSS HQ which was under siege to retaliate and gather knowledge of the attacker. The first attempt was made to leave the HQ in buses with a tractor leading the way, this effort was aborted after the gate could not be opened as it was jammed due to damage. The second attempt was made through the Defence Ministry gate (then Police HQ gate) on foot. 11 soldiers with task force training volunteered for this mission. After being organized and briefed on the mission by Maj. Gen Jaleel (then Lt.), the patrol was addressed by Maj. Gen (Ret.) Mohamed Zahir (then Major) who was the leading Commander at the NSS HQ at the time.
The patrol formed up on the half wall fronting the street then with Maj. Gen Jaleel, the commander at the lead of the patrol, ran out through the gate and along Ameeru Ahmed magu towards Huravee Building. Due to reasons unknown only 9 member were able to run out the gate with 2 members remaining inside. As the attackers noticed the patrol running out of the HQ they intensified the fire towards them and additionally a member of the patrol slipped and was unable to use his weapon to return fire which resulted in 3 member of the patrol being killed under fire. The remaining 6 members completed their mission and returned back inside the base through the same gate.
The mission is undoubtedly the most daring in the modern military history of the country. The soldiers who volunteered for the mission undertook it with full knowledge that they were venturing out a HQ which was under siege and into the hail of bullets from the attackers. And Maj. Gen Jaleel holds a legendary status in the MNDF as the commander who led this mission.
== Family ==
Maj. General Jaleel is currently married to Mrs. Jazeela Ibrahim. He has 5 children, with 1 from the current marriage and 4 from previous marriages.
[[Category:Maldivian military personnel]]

;India * Defence Services Staff College, Wellington * National Defence College, New Delhi

The patrol formed up on the half wall fronting the street then with Maj. Due to reasons unknown only 9 member were able to run out the gate with 2 members remaining inside. As the attackers noticed the patrol running out of the HQ they intensified the fire towards them and additionally a member of the patrol slipped and was unable to use his weapon to return fire which resulted in 3 member of the patrol being killed under fire. The remaining 6 members completed their mission and returned back inside the base through the same gate.
The mission is undoubtedly the most daring in the modern military history of the country. The soldiers who volunteered for the mission undertook it with full knowledge that they were venturing out a HQ which was under siege and into the hail of bullets from the attackers. And Maj. Gen Jaleel holds a legendary status in the MNDF as the commander who led this mission.
== Family ==
